news_items.headline: Alibaba offers $2.86 billion in loans to firms hit by coronavirus outbreak
news_items.lede: Alibaba Group Holdings said on Monday its affiliate Ant Financial's MYBank unit would offer 20 billion yuan ($2.86 billion) in loans to companies in China in light of the coronavirus outbreak, with preferential terms for Hubei firms.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Alibaba Group is seen inside DingTalk office, an offshoot of Alibaba Group Holding Ltd, in Hangzhou, Zhejiang province, China July 20, 2018. Picture taken July 20, 2018. REUTERS/Aly Song

news_items.headline: CORRECTED-Alibaba offers $2.86 bln in loans to firms hit by coronavirus outbreak
news_items.lede: Alibaba Group Holdings said on Monday its affiliate Ant Financial's MYBank unit would offer 20 billion yuan ($2.86 billion) in loans to companies in China in light of the coronavirus outbreak, with preferential terms for Hubei firms.

news_items.headline: CORRECTED-Alibaba offers $2.86 bln in loans to firms hit by coronavirus outbreak
news_items.lede: Alibaba Group Holdings said on Monday its affiliate Ant Financial's MYBank unit would offer 20 billion yuan ($2.86 billion) in loans to companies in China in light of the coronavirus outbreak, with preferential terms for Hubei firms.

news_items.headline: Ant Financial pauses credit rating service amid coronavirus outbreak
news_items.lede: A Chinese credit rating service backed by Alibaba affiliate Ant Financial stopped updating scores as of Wednesday, saying many users could miss payments because of the coronavirus outbreak, a reflection of emerging financial pains caused by disease.

news_items.headline: REFILE-Alibaba-backed fund to build HQ in Saudi 'media city'
news_items.lede: Saudi Arabia has signed an agreement with a fund linked to China's Alibaba to build a new headquarters in a "media city" in the kingdom's capital, the Saudi minister of culture said on Tuesday.

news_items.headline: Alibaba's Taobao takes down overpriced face masks on its marketplace
news_items.lede: Alibaba's <BABA.N> Taobao marketplace said on Sunday that it has removed sales of face masks from shops that show "unstable prices or false advertising", as prices for the products surged as Chinese consumers race to protect themselves from the coronavirus outbreak.

news_items.headline: Alibaba's Taobao takes down overpriced face masks on its marketplace
news_items.lede: Alibaba's Taobao marketplace said on Sunday that it has removed sales of face masks from shops that show "unstable prices or false advertising", as prices for the products surged as Chinese consumers race to protect themselves from the coronavirus outbreak.

news_items.headline: Alibaba's Taobao takes down overpriced face masks on its marketplace
news_items.lede: Alibaba's Taobao marketplace said on Sunday that it has removed sales of face masks from shops that show "unstable prices or false advertising", as prices for the products surged as Chinese consumers race to protect themselves from the coronavirus outbreak.

news_items.headline: BRIEF-Altaba Says In Connection With Plan Of Complete Liquidation & Dissolution, On Jan 13, Fund Began Selling Remaining Holdings Of Alibaba's ADS
news_items.lede: * ALTABA SAYS IN CONNECTION WITH PLAN OF COMPLETE LIQUIDATION & DISSOLUTION, ON JAN 13, FUND BEGAN SELLING REMAINING HOLDINGS OF ALIBABA'S ADS - SEC FILING

news_items.headline: Alibaba praised by China's gay community for ad recognizing same-sex couples
news_items.lede: Online gay communities in China are lauding e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding Ltd for releasing a subtle ad that appears to feature a gay couple returning home for the Lunar New Year.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A woman walks with a shopping bag with Tmall logo during Alibaba Group's 11.11 Singles' Day global shopping festival in Shanghai, China, November 11, 2017. REUTERS/Aly Song/File Photo

news_items.headline: Ant Financial appoints Simon Hu as CEO, part of Alibaba's executive shuffle
news_items.lede: E-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding Ltd <BABA.N> and its fintech affiliate Ant Financial announced a string of top level executive changes on Thursday, amid an ongoing restructuring following the appointment of Daniel Zhang as chairman of Alibaba.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Ant Financial's CEO Eric Jing attends the World Internet Conference (WIC) in Wuzhen, Zhejiang province, China, October 20, 2019. REUTERS/Aly Song

news_items.headline: Ant Financial CTO Cheng Li to replace Jeff Zhang as CTO of Alibaba Group -internal letter
news_items.lede: Ant Financial Chief Technology Officer Cheng Li will replace Jeff Zhang as the CTO of Alibaba, according to an internal company letter seen by Reuters.

news_items.headline: Nvidia touts chip deals with China's Alibaba, Baidu and Didi
news_items.lede: Nvidia Corp on Wednesday said it has won a series of deals in which some of China's biggest technology companies are using its chips to make product recommendations and to develop self-driving vehicles.

news_items.headline: Manchester United sign new partnership deal with Alibaba
news_items.lede: Premier League soccer club Manchester United have agreed a partnership with e-commerce giant Alibaba in an effort to extend the club's engagement with fans in China.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Soccer Football - Premier League - Manchester United v Tottenham Hotspur - Old Trafford, Manchester, Britain - December 4, 2019  General view of a fan wearing a scarf bearing the faces of Tottenham Hotspur manager Jose Mourinho and Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer outside the stadium before the match   REUTERS/Andrew Yates  EDITORIAL USE ONLY. No use with unauthorized audio, video, data, fixture lists, club/league logos or "live" services. Online in-match use limited to 75 images, no video emulation. No use in betting, games or single club/league/player publications.  Please contact your account representative for further details./File Photo

news_items.headline: SoftBank's Son sticks with gut-led investing in chat with Alibaba's Ma
news_items.lede: Weeks after his billion-dollar bailout of WeWork, SoftBank Group Corp's founder and CEO Masayoshi Son reiterated his belief in an instinct-led investing style, in a discussion with Alibaba Group Holding Inc's co-founder Jack Ma.
news_items.img_cap: SoftBank Group founder and CEO Masayoshi Son and Alibaba founder and former Chairman Jack Ma shake hands at the Tokyo Forum 2019 in Tokyo, Japan, December 6, 2019. REUTERS/Kim Kyung-Hoon

news_items.headline: Soccer-Manchester United sign new partnership deal with Alibaba
news_items.lede: Premier League soccer club Manchester United have agreed a partnership deal with Alibaba which will see the Chinese e-commerce giant provide club content on its online video company Youku.com and develop a future store on the company's business-to-consumer platform Tmall.com...

news_items.headline: CORRECTED-SoftBank's Son cleaves to gut-led investing in chat with Alibaba's Ma
news_items.lede: Weeks after his billion-dollar bailout of WeWork, SoftBank Group Corp's founder and CEO Masayoshi Son reiterated his belief in an instinct-led investing style, in a discussion with Alibaba Group Holding Inc's co-founder Jack Ma.

news_items.headline: Timeline: Saudi Aramco's winding road to an IPO
news_items.lede: State-run oil giant Saudi Aramco has priced its initial public offering (IPO) at the top of its indicative range, making it the world's biggest flotation by raising more than Alibaba's <BABA.N> $25 billion listing in 2014.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Aramco is seen as security personnel walk before the start of a press conference by Aramco at the Plaza Conference Center in Dhahran, Saudi Arabia November 3, 2019. REUTERS/Hamad I Mohammed

news_items.headline: TIMELINE-Saudi Aramco's winding road to an IPO
news_items.lede: State-run oil giant Saudi Aramco has priced its initial public offering (IPO) at the top of its indicative range, making it the world's biggest flotation by raising more than Alibaba's $25 billion listing in 2014.

news_items.headline: Saudi Aramco shares priced at top of range in world's biggest IPO
news_items.lede: State-owned oil giant Saudi Aramco has priced its initial public offering (IPO) at the top of its indicative range, the company said on Thursday, making it the world's biggest flotation by raising more than Alibaba's <BABA.N> $25 billion listing in 2014.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A sign of Saudi Aramco's initial public offering (IPO) is seen during a news conference by the state oil company at the Plaza Conference Center in Dhahran, Saudi Arabia November 3, 2019. REUTERS/Hamad I Mohammed

news_items.headline: Saudi Aramco prices shares at top of range in world's biggest IPO - sources
news_items.lede: DUBAI/RIYADH, Dec 5 Reuters) - State-owned oil giant Saudi Aramco has priced its initial public offering (IPO) at the top of its indicative range, three sources told Reuters, making it the world's biggest flotation as it will raise more than Alibaba's $25 billion deal in...

news_items.headline: Exclusive: Alibaba-backed startup AutoX applies for driver-less test permit in California
news_items.lede: Chinese startup AutoX, backed by e-commerce giant Alibaba, has applied to test self-driving vehicles without an in-car backup driver in California, the first challenger to Alphabet Inc's autonomous driving venture Waymo to say it has done so.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A Waymo autonomous vehicle (formerly the Google self-driving car project) is displayed at the Fiat Chrysler Automobiles booth during the 2019 CES in Las Vegas, Nevada, U.S. January 8, 2019. REUTERS/Steve Marcus/File Photo

news_items.headline: UPDATE 1-Alibaba raises further $1.7 bln in over-allotted shares in HK listing
news_items.lede: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba said on Tuesday it has raised an additional HK$13.17 billion ($1.68 billion) by exercising the over-allotment option in its Hong Kong secondary listing.

news_items.headline: Alibaba raises further $1.7 billion in over-allotted shares in HK listing
news_items.lede: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba said on Tuesday it has raised an additional HK$13.17 billion ($1.68 billion) by exercising the over-allotment option in its Hong Kong secondary listing.
news_items.img_cap: Alibaba's Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Daniel Zhang, Hong Kong Financial Secretary Paul Chan and former Hong Kong chief executive Tung Chee-hwa attend Alibaba Group's listing ceremony at the Hong Kong Stock Exchange (HKEX) in Hong Kong, China November 26, 2019. REUTERS/Stringer  ATTENTION EDITORS - THIS IMAGE WAS PROVIDED BY A THIRD PARTY. CHINA OUT.

news_items.headline: Saudi exchange to limit Aramco index weighting with cap
news_items.lede: Saudi Arabia's Tadawul has introduced an equity index <.TASI> cap of 15% which is set to address concerns over the weighting oil giant Saudi Aramco will have when it lists on the exchange.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Yasser al-Rumayyan, Saudi Aramco's chairman, and Amin H. Nasser, president and CEO of Aramco, attend a news conference at the Plaza Conference Center in Dhahran, Saudi Arabia November 3, 2019. REUTERS/Hamad I Mohammed/File Photo

news_items.headline: Factbox: From Madison Square Garden to Alibaba, Silver Lake's $43 billion empire
news_items.lede: U.S. private equity firm Silver Lake has bought a 10% stake in Manchester City's Abu Dhabi-controlled owner, adding to its $43 billion worth of investments which include the world's best-known sports venues and teams as well as technology companies.

news_items.headline: Breakingviews - Alibaba listing opens new front in Tencent rivalry
news_items.lede: A new front has opened up in China's biggest tech rivalry. Hong Kong investors can now own shares in both Alibaba and Tencent after the e-commerce giant’s local offering. If regulators permit, the pair will soon be fighting over mainland shareholders, as well as digital...
news_items.img_cap: Alibaba's Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Daniel Zhang, Hong Kong Financial Secretary Paul Chan and former Hong Kong chief executive Tung Chee-hwa attend Alibaba Group's listing ceremony at the Hong Kong Stock Exchange (HKEX) in Hong Kong, China November 26, 2019. REUTERS/Stringer  ATTENTION EDITORS - THIS IMAGE WAS PROVIDED BY A THIRD PARTY. CHINA OUT.

news_items.headline: Alibaba gets strong demand for $13.4 billion Hong Kong listing: sources
news_items.lede: Alibaba's <BABA.N> order books for its $13.4 billion Hong Kong share sale have already been covered "multiple times," sources with direct knowledge of the matter said on Friday, as the ecommerce group kicked off its campaign for the secondary listing in the city gripped...
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A logo of Alibaba Group is seen during Alibaba Group's 11.11 Singles' Day global shopping festival at the company's headquarters in Hangzhou, Zhejiang province, China, November 11, 2019. REUTERS/Aly Song/File Photo

news_items.headline: Alibaba's $13.4 billion bookbuild covered multiple times: sources
news_items.lede: Alibaba's $13.4 billion institutional bookbuild for its Hong Kong listing is already covered "multiple times," according to a message sent to investors and verified by sources with direct knowledge of the matter.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Alibaba Group is seen at the company's headquarters in Hangzhou, Zhejiang province, China July 20, 2018. REUTERS/Aly Song/File Photo

news_items.headline: Explainer: Why is Alibaba listing in Hong Kong?
news_items.lede: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba is set to price its first share sale in Hong Kong next week, raising up to $13.4 billion in what will be the largest deal in the city since 2010 and the world's biggest ever cross-border secondary listing.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A logo of Alibaba Group is seen during Alibaba Group's 11.11 Singles' Day global shopping festival at the company's headquarters in Hangzhou, Zhejiang province, China, November 11, 2019. REUTERS/Aly Song/File Photo

news_items.headline: Alibaba praises Hong Kong ahead of $13.4 bln listing
news_items.lede: Alibaba Group Chairman Daniel Zhang said Hong Kong's "future is bright" as the company presses on with its secondary listing in the city gripped by increasingly violent protests and recession.

news_items.headline: Alibaba's Hong Kong listing offers valuable Beijing goodwill
news_items.lede: Alibaba's Hong Kong listing will not only land it $13.4 billion, it will also garner goodwill from Beijing to help the Chinese e-commerce giant weather the fallout of a damaging trade war.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A logo of Alibaba Group is seen during Alibaba Group's 11.11 Singles' Day global shopping festival at the company's headquarters in Hangzhou, Zhejiang province, China, November 11, 2019. REUTERS/Aly Song/File Photo

news_items.headline: Alibaba to pioneer paperless listing in break with Hong Kong norm
news_items.lede: Alibaba's planned $13.4 billion share sale will be Hong Kong's first paperless stock market listing, a source with knowledge of the matter said, breaking with a long-held tradition of investors placing stock orders in bank branches.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A logo of Alibaba Group is seen during Alibaba Group's 11.11 Singles' Day global shopping festival at the company's headquarters in Hangzhou, Zhejiang province, China, November 11, 2019. REUTERS/Aly Song/File Photo

news_items.headline: Alibaba goes paperless for $13.4 bln listing in a first for Hong Kong - source
news_items.lede: Alibaba Group will carry out Hong Kong’s first paper-less stock market listing with its $13.4 billion share sale, according to a source with knowledge of the matter, ending the long-held tradition of Hong Kong investors queuing in bank branches to place stock orders.

news_items.headline: Hong Kong interbank rates rise ahead of huge Alibaba listing
news_items.lede: The Hong Kong Interbank Offered Rate (HIBOR) rose across the curve on Thursday after Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group launched a $13.4 billion listing in the city.

news_items.headline: Alibaba launches $13.4 billion Hong Kong listing to fund expansion
news_items.lede: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group launched the share sale for its Hong Kong listing on Wednesday, braving unrest in the global financial hub to try to raise up to $13.4 billion to fund its expansion plans.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A logo of Alibaba Group is seen at the World Internet Conference (WIC) in Wuzhen, Zhejiang province, China, Oct. 20, 2019. REUTERS/Aly Song/File Photo

news_items.headline: Alibaba's Jack Ma says Singles' Day shopping results miss expectations
news_items.lede: Alibaba Group Holding Inc co-founder Jack Ma said on Wednesday results from the Singles' Day annual online shopping festival had missed the Chinese e-commerce giant's expectations.
news_items.img_cap: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd Executive Chairman Jack Ma attends the World Artificial Intelligence Conference (WAIC) with Tesla Inc CEO Elon Musk (not pictured) in Shanghai, China, August 29, 2019. REUTERS/Aly Song/File Photo

news_items.headline: Alibaba opens bookbuild for Hong Kong listing: sources
news_items.lede: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group has opened the trading books for its $13.4 billion Hong Kong listing, two sources with direct knowledge of the process told Reuters on Wednesday.

news_items.headline: Alibaba opens bookbuild for Hong Kong listing - sources
news_items.lede: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group has opened the trading books for its $13.4 billion Hong Kong listing, two sources with direct knowledge of the process told Reuters on Wednesday.
